definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: How can parents in father-absent homes compensate, if at all?
sentences.chinese: 在父爱缺失的家庭，父母该如何补偿孩子？

sentences.english: Therefore doth my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.
sentences.chinese: 我父爱我，因我将命舍去，好再取回来。

sentences.english: At that time other engraves , my real feeling father love.
sentences.chinese: 彼时彼刻，我真的感受到了父爱。

sentences.english: The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.
sentences.chinese: 父爱子，已将万有交在他手里。

sentences.english: A father is a walking stick, let us in life less tumble.
sentences.chinese: 父爱是拐杖，让我们在人生中少摔跟头。

sentences.english: The Father loves the Son and has placed everything in his hands.
sentences.chinese: 父爱子，已将万有交在他手里。

sentences.english: 17The reason my Father loves me is that I lay down my life--only to take it up again.
sentences.chinese: 我父爱我，因我将命舍去，好再取回来。

sentences.english: The act of fathering is the foundation of human civilization.
sentences.chinese: 父爱父行是人类文明的根基。

sentences.english: They averaged +1 on the paternal-investment index.
sentences.chinese: 这类孩子的“父爱指数”平均为1。

sentences.english: Father is ZhuangHangJiu, cowardice when given an infinite courage.
sentences.chinese: 父爱是壮行酒，懦弱时给予无穷胆量。

sentences.english: I quickly realized that among the Collector's sentiments, fatherly feeling was by far the strongest.
sentences.chinese: 我很快就发现了在这个税务官身上，父爱高于一切。

sentences.english: 35The Father loves the Son and has placed everything in his hands.
sentences.chinese: 父爱子，已将万有交在他手里。

sentences.english: Deep sea motherly love, fatherly love heavy as a mountain.
sentences.chinese: 母爱深似海，父爱重如山。

sentences.english: Watching my sweating father, I can feel his love for me.
sentences.chinese: 看着满头大汗的爸爸，我感觉到了父爱。

sentences.english: Fatherly or motherly love has lost a child, known as the "angel wing."
sentences.chinese: 失去了父爱或是母爱的孩子，被称为“单翼天使”。

definition: to show concern and care for
affection/family love/love, esp. within a married couple or between parents and children
lit. the cow licking its calf fondly (idiom)/fig. to show deep affection towards one's children
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to be fondly attached to/to not wish to part with/to cling to
